sub_title: Director, European Analytical and Microbiology Group,  Research Development & Engineering at Ecolab
summary:
Senior Group Leader with significant multi-national experience in research and industrial application of microbiology and molecular biology.

The study of the peptides and genetics of antimicrobial lactic acid bacteria from breweries was my passport to industrial microbiological research supplemented with the latest molecular biological technologies around the world and now to leading a dynamic team in Ecolab.  Understanding and controlling microbes is more important than ever and I’ve had the opportunity to study and work with institutes and companies to develop this expertise.

Having worked for Ecolab and Heineken in various locations, consistently delivering project goals on time and in budget whilst fully meeting stakeholders’ expectations, I further developed my core strengths of:
•	Cross functional team leadership
•	Project management, and
•	Microbiology and molecular biology specialist knowledge.

In academia, I have mentored students, supervised research projects and delivered lectures on:
• Industrial Microbiology,
• Medical Microbiology,
• Environmental Microbiology
• Biotechnology, and
• Food Microbiology including beer, dairy and cocoa fermentation.

Due to my international experience, I have gained an understanding of different cultural perspectives. This, plus a drive to face challenges head on, learn new things and broaden my horizons, enabled me to work in each country I have lived in - overcoming legal (work permits) as well as cultural and language obstacles.

My key achievements to date include:
• Designing and leading organisational restructuring and change management.
• Being part of an innovation team which led to a globally recognized product.
• Managing the implementation of rapid microbiological detection assays worldwide.
• Ensuring product quality and assessing product risk, resulting in difficult decisions yet maintaining good working relationships with the teams involved.
• Adapting and challenging myself in new situations such as going from academia to industry, gaining expertise in diverse fields as brewing, medical microbiology, tropical ecology, chocolate and biocides.
• Developing strong team capabilities and mentoring students.

I enjoy solving problems and constantly learning.

awards.title: Heineken Ireland Research Fellowship
awards.description: Awarded postdoctoral fellowship to investigate application of the microbiota of malthouses and breweries

certifications.name: Certificate of Continuing Professional Development - University of Nottingham, U.K.

profile_positions.title: European Director of Analytical and Microbiology, Research Development & Engineering

profile_positions.description:
The European Microbiology Group is a cross divisional group that supports:
•	Ecolab’s customers by conducting microbiological analyses and offering expert advice by our subject matter experts for our customers’ routine operations and troubleshooting 
•	Innovation as part of the team that develops Ecolab’s products and services for the future
•	Our sales teams by supplying efficacy data for our product label claims and fulfilling our regulatory commitments by providing data for the efficacy portions of the European Biocidal Products Regulation dossiers submitted by Ecolab
profile_positions.title: European Microbiology Group Leader, Research Development and Engineering
Senior Group Leader and European Microbiology Group Manager

company.name: University of the West Indies, St. Augustine Campus

profile_positions.company: University of the West Indies, St. Augustine Campus
profile_positions.description:
I lectured on topics in areas of:
- Environmental Microbiology, 
- Ecological Health 
- Food Microbiology including cocoa, dairy and beer fermentation.

I redesigned lecture content, within given parameters, to bring lectures to life utilizing real examples drawn from personal international experience. 

Highlight:
Completed the ‘Introductory Chocolate Making Course’ (Cocoa Research Centre) focusing on cocoa processing from bean to chocolate bar which enabled access to the International Cocoa Genebank in Trinidad, the largest repository of cocoa tree varieties in the world.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for aligning the microbiological quality standards of the four Heineken Romania breweries by:

- conducting annual audits of each brewery with particular focus on cleaning and disinfection regimes 

- assessing alternative methods of product stabilization with potential for energy and cost saving without compromising the quality of finished product.

Highlight:
Aligned local policies and standards with respect to microbiology and hygienic filling with those of Heineken Headquarters in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Microbiology Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I transferred effortlessly from brewing industry to academia, built a strong team, learnt about tropical ecology and was promoted twice.  I was accountable for:

- delivering lectures and practical assignments to international groups of final year B.Sc. students with excellent feedback in the following areas: Food and Industrial Microbiology, Medical Microbiology, Environmental Microbiology and Biotechnology,

- creating research links with industrial partners in Malaysia that provided students with an automatic careers network and enabled access to authentic samples and microbes for laboratory work,

- mentoring students and supervised postgraduate students’ research projects.

Highlight:
I was appointed unit coordinator for several units, liaising with the Faculty of Science, Monash University, Melbourne, Australia and learned a lot about Tropical Ecology.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
This was a Project Leader role for research projects combined with providing support to Heineken breweries worldwide particularly with aseptic packaging. Main responsilbiles included: 

- acting as advisor to the Policy Department on issues relating to product quality, product integrity and food safety,

- advising, auditing and troubleshooting in the event of microbiological issues,

- involvement in several initiatives to improve product quality at the consumer interface in conjunction with commercial groups in the company,

- designing, executing and presenting results of fundamental research projects related to microbiology,

- supporting many process, product and packaging innovation projects through the development and implementation stages,

- training staff at different levels through international workshops on microbiology and hygiene in production operations.

Highlights:
Project managed the implementation of rapid microbiological detection assays in breweries and soft drinks operations in order to manage product risk and allow considerable cost savings per operating company by reducing product quarantine time.

Formulated and implemented microbiological standards for all breweries that produce Heineken products worldwide.
profile_positions.title: Scientist Microbiology

profile_positions.description: The objective of this project was to investigate the production of bacteriocins by ‘good’ lactic acid bacteria from brewing environments and whether these could inhibit ‘bad’ beer spoiling bacteria in a natural way.
profile_positions.title: Heineken Ireland Fellow
